title.value: Determinants of Access to Essential Surgery in the Democratic Republic of Congo
title.justification: The title is clearly stated in the beginning of the paper as 'Determinants of Access to Essential Surgery in the Democratic Republic of Congo'.
title.quote:
Determinants of Access to Essential Surgery in the
Democratic Republic of Congo

extractions.description: This paper investigates the barriers and determinants affecting access to essential surgical procedures in the Democratic Republic of Congo. It employs a community-based, cross-sectional study to assess the unmet surgical needs and the reasons behind not seeking or obtaining Bellwether surgeries.

type.justification: The paper is empirical as it involves a cross-sectional study surveying community members to gather data about surgical access and unmet needs in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
type.quote: Methods: A cross-sectional study evaluated access to essential surgery in the Butembo and Katwa health zones in the North Kivu province of DRC.

name.justification: The core focus of the paper is on understanding and evaluating factors that affect access to essential healthcare services, particularly surgeries, in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
name.quote: Conclusions: Access and delivery of essential surgery are drastically limited in the North Kivu province of the DRC, such that a quarter of households needing surgery fails to seek surgical care.

name.justification: The paper addresses global health issues, focusing on surgical access in low and middle-income countries, specifically in Africa.
name.quote: In the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), the determinants and barriers of essential surgical care are not well described, hindering efforts to improve national surgical programs and access.

name.justification: It explores social factors and economic barriers affecting the decision to access surgical care, making it a significant sub-field.
name.quote: Poor access was predominantly driven by householdsâ€™ inability to pay for surgery and community distrust of the hospital system.

name.value: Surgeons OverSeas Surgical Needs Assessment Survey
name.justification: This survey tool was used in the study to assess the reasons for not seeking or receiving necessary surgeries.
name.quote: ...surveyed using questions derived from the Surgeons OverSeas Surgical Needs Assessment Survey, a validated tool to determine the reasons for not seeking, reaching, or receiving a Bellwether surgery.

referenced_paper_title.value: Surgeons OverSeas Assessment of surgical need (SOSAS) version 3.0
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper is the source of the Surgeons OverSeas Surgical Needs Assessment Survey tool that was used for data collection in this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Questions explored all possible determinants of the lack of access to essential surgery using questions adapted from the validated tool developed by the Harvard University of the USA and endorsed by the World Health Organization: The Surgeons OverSeas Assessment of Surgical Need survey version 3.0 (see Appendix for survey used).
